etymologies: mid 17th century: via medieval Latin from Greek patriarkhia, from patriarkhēs ‘ruling father’ (see patriarch)

definitions: a system of society or government in which the father or eldest male is head of the family and descent is traced through the male line

examples.text: the thematic relationships of the ballad are worked out according to the conventional archetypes of the patriarchy

shortDefinitions: system of society or government in which father or eldest male is head of family and descent is reckoned through male line

definitions: a system of society or government in which men hold the power and women are largely excluded from it
shortDefinitions: system of society or government in which men hold power and women are largely excluded from it

definitions: a society or community organized on patriarchal lines
shortDefinitions: society or community organized on patriarchal lines
